revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-08-07 16:56:28.000000000', 'files': ['jenkins/jobs/projects.yaml', 'zuul/layout.yaml', 'grafana/neutron.yaml'], 'message': 'Make neutron functional job non-voting

It currently blocks merging patches due to multiple instability issues
that are most likely not related to neutron code, and leaving it this
way so close to release is unsafe.

Change-Id: Ib14ee3cdd9ea0004f5e50204b72819c1c5c54367
Related-Bug: #1707933
Related-Bug: #1709032
'}]
commit_message:
Make neutron functional job non-voting

It currently blocks merging patches due to multiple instability issues
that are most likely not related to neutron code, and leaving it this
way so close to release is unsafe.

This patch is expected to revert asap when we regain control of the job
state.

Change-Id: Ib14ee3cdd9ea0004f5e50204b72819c1c5c54367
Related-Bug: #1707933
Related-Bug: #1709032

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-08-15 14:12:23.000000000', 'files': ['manifests/certificates.pp', 'spec/classes/octavia_certificates_spec.rb', 'releasenotes/notes/add-certificates-configuration-6e956bd99e5c2a2b.yaml'], 'message': 'Add certificate configuration for PKI

Octavia uses PKI in order to securely communicate over REST between

(cherry picked from commit 8b4707a1f5ffda5f6e4416d4f69bbf033df483e5)

commit_message:
Add certificate configuration for PKI

Octavia uses PKI in order to securely communicate over REST between
the control plane and the amphorae.  However, there is no option to
currently configure these options at the moment.

This patch adds a class which helps configure these options to be
able to successfully communicate with PKI.  It is important that
the SSL certificates must still be generated by the user.

Change-Id: Ifbf5cd5118e6d02c514589ecbce9d49096faf242
(cherry picked from commit 8b4707a1f5ffda5f6e4416d4f69bbf033df483e5)

subject: Resolve Macros when copying templates
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-07-05 14:41:45.000000000', 'files': ['heat/engine/function.py'], 'message': "Resolve Macros when copying templates

During stack updates in the legacy path, we copy resource definitions
back and forth between templates. In the case where the definitions
contain macros (which in practice means the If macro for conditionals),
they may rely on external state (in practice, the conditional
definitions) that is not available in the template they're being copied
into (e.g. in the case of an If macro referencing a new condition).

This change means that when we copy a template, the macros get resolved
so that only the chosen path of the If macro is represented.

This resolves the issue where trying to signal a resource during an
update fails when one of the already-updated resources in the template
contains an If macro that refers to a condition definition that is
newly-added in the new template.

Change-Id: I6d08507f43b0fcc4c0b5e848e97fa26033d839b2
Closes-Bug: #1699463
(cherry picked from commit ba0b570054f89c72d261e2e2d0aedd55c4fe2344)
"}]
commit_message:
Resolve Macros when copying templates

During stack updates in the legacy path, we copy resource definitions
back and forth between templates. In the case where the definitions
contain macros (which in practice means the If macro for conditionals),
they may rely on external state (in practice, the conditional
definitions) that is not available in the template they're being copied
into (e.g. in the case of an If macro referencing a new condition).

This change means that when we copy a template, the macros get resolved
so that only the chosen path of the If macro is represented.

This resolves the issue where trying to signal a resource during an
update fails when one of the already-updated resources in the template
contains an If macro that refers to a condition definition that is
newly-added in the new template.

Change-Id: I6d08507f43b0fcc4c0b5e848e97fa26033d839b2
Closes-Bug: #1699463
(cherry picked from commit ba0b570054f89c72d261e2e2d0aedd55c4fe2344)

commit_message:
Fix snapshot/restore of volumes

This fixes the snapshot of the volume resource by passing the force
flag, and the restore by detaching it properly beforehand.

Change-Id: I69936a12fe6bca44ee445cdfe0cedb38a5926f32
Closes-Bug: #1687006
(cherry picked from commit b2f990d6c87475015866c8644762dabc3f88eea1)

subject: Fix gate mtu tests
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2017-08-16 10:59:46.000000000', 'files': ['networking_ovn/tests/unit/ml2/test_mech_driver.py'], 'message': "Fix gate mtu tests

This new commit [1] in neutron checks mtu size during segment
allocation and throws exception if MTU > 1450 for geneve network
type. Because of this new change, tests
'test_clear_segment_host_mapping' and
'test_update_segment_host_mapping' are failing in gate.

To fix this, we are updating mtu to 1450 in the test, before it
creates geneve segments for the network.

[1] ceb86366d25a928d7a3773075a7333801ee3dd29

Closes-bug: #1710496
Change-Id: I117cc2352848718b37f95bdb6aecbfb6ba1ccc67
(cherry picked from commit 12f0d9f3992ce3f08d68d8102ec5d5f9b138c756)
"}]
commit_message:
Fix gate mtu tests

This new commit [1] in neutron checks mtu size during segment
allocation and throws exception if MTU > 1450 for geneve network
type. Because of this new change, tests
'test_clear_segment_host_mapping' and
'test_update_segment_host_mapping' are failing in gate.

To fix this, we are updating mtu to 1450 in the test, before it
creates geneve segments for the network.

[1] ceb86366d25a928d7a3773075a7333801ee3dd29

Closes-bug: #1710496
Change-Id: I117cc2352848718b37f95bdb6aecbfb6ba1ccc67
(cherry picked from commit 12f0d9f3992ce3f08d68d8102ec5d5f9b138c756)

subject: Ubuntu: Use dnsmasq-base, not dnsmasq
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-08-16 16:47:33.000000000', 'files': ['tasks/main.yml', 'tasks/lxc_dnsmasq_cleanup.yml', 'releasenotes/notes/dnsmasq-lxc-conflict-fix-c8968f6a16d033c6.yaml', 'tasks/lxc_install_apt.yml', 'vars/ubuntu-14.04.yml', 'vars/ubuntu-16.04.yml'], 'message': "Ubuntu: Use dnsmasq-base, not dnsmasq

In Ubuntu the 'dnsmasq' package actually includes
init scripts and service configuration which
conflict with LXC and are best not included. The
actual dependent package is 'dnsmasq-base'.

With this change, the cleanup is no longer
required because the files are removed by the
purge or not installed in the first place.

Closes-Bug: #1711140
Change-Id: I0b0a8dec3943651f379479ea1a3b8038736b9219
(cherry picked from commit d5bef82dfedc72eb2d51ef899578098c35738085)
"}]
commit_message:
Ubuntu: Use dnsmasq-base, not dnsmasq

In Ubuntu the 'dnsmasq' package actually includes
init scripts and service configuration which
conflict with LXC and are best not included. The
actual dependent package is 'dnsmasq-base'.

With this change, the cleanup is no longer
required because the files are removed by the
purge or not installed in the first place.

Closes-Bug: #1711140
Change-Id: I0b0a8dec3943651f379479ea1a3b8038736b9219
(cherry picked from commit d5bef82dfedc72eb2d51ef899578098c35738085)

commit_message:
Ubuntu: Use dnsmasq-base, not dnsmasq

In Ubuntu the 'dnsmasq' package actually includes
init scripts and service configuration which
conflict with LXC and are best not included. The
actual dependent package is 'dnsmasq-base'.

With this change, the cleanup is no longer
required because the files are removed by the
purge or not installed in the first place.

Closes-Bug: #1711140
Change-Id: I0b0a8dec3943651f379479ea1a3b8038736b9219
(cherry picked from commit d5bef82dfedc72eb2d51ef899578098c35738085)

commit_message:
Define shell.COMMANDS explicitly to avoid random UT failure

Mocking non-existing attribute causes UT failure.
As a result, neutronclient UT fails depending on
executing order of tests.

Change-Id: Id047527fba9e908938f7157781fb0e36e76011c7
Closes-Bug: #1709652
(cherry picked from commit 4c3fbe2639664c25d3c06522f9c85713e65bb893)

commit_message:
[Docs] Add documentation contribution docs

Now that we are in charge of managing our documentation I thought
we should have a section in the Contributor Guide on
how to contribute documentation.  This patch adds that.

It also resolves build WARNINGS due to the README files I added
not being included in any toctrees and adds the missing README
file to the install directory.

Change-Id: I8e12628b439a400ebd1ee6d691673a16e2c2f9d2

commit_message:
Deprecate [rbac] configuration group.

The [rbac] configuration group has been deprecated
and will be removed in the next release. It has been
renamed to the [patrole] group which contains
the exact same options.

This commit makes necessary deprecation changes,
along with renaming changes to documentation, unit
tests and framework.

Change-Id: I71198506b97b98ac18a969b7e6b13b664579c081

subject: Historical services can violate naming rules
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2017-08-16 15:38:43.000000000', 'files': ['README.rst'], 'message': "Historical services can violate naming rules

After a few attempts at retrofitting the newly-minted service type
naming rules to established services, we've discovered that's more
hassle than it's worth.

This change updates the guidelines to make it okay for historical
service types to keep their established names, while reinforcing that
new service types should conform to the stated rules.

Change-Id: I1f9d45ae1ccc0a397e2cc83dc8bb61a9b61971fe
"}]
commit_message:
Historical services can violate naming rules

After a few attempts at retrofitting the newly-minted service type
naming rules to established services, we've discovered that's more
hassle than it's worth.

This change updates the guidelines to make it okay for historical
service types to keep their established names, while reinforcing that
new service types should conform to the stated rules.

Change-Id: I1f9d45ae1ccc0a397e2cc83dc8bb61a9b61971fe

subject: Run gnocchi::db::sync only in step 4
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2017-07-27 10:48:53.000000000', 'files': ['manifests/profile/base/gnocchi/api.pp'], 'message': 'Run gnocchi::db::sync only in step 4

We just need to run the gnocchi-upgrade in step 4. Since we
dont run upgrade once without and then with storage, no need
to run it again in later steps. This will also prevent it
from running into race conditions when apache gets bounced
later.

Change-Id: I1662d66d7e695e7ae8363152075a925358f9e1d1
'}]
commit_message:
Run gnocchi::db::sync only in step 4

We just need to run the gnocchi-upgrade in step 4. Since we
dont run upgrade once without and then with storage, no need
to run it again in later steps. This will also prevent it
from running into race conditions when apache gets bounced
later.

Change-Id: I1662d66d7e695e7ae8363152075a925358f9e1d1

commit_message:
container/upgrades: unconditionally create containers-default-parameters.yaml

If we don't want to pull and push containers from a docker registry to a
local mirror, because we already have a mirror that we want to directly
use, we just need to manage /containers-default-parameters.yaml and
write the Docker registry address.

Change-Id: I905045140108c1da4ca425ae7f0411ab3c63f218

commit_message:
tempest: Avoid using dvr extension

The "distributed" attribute is a part of dvr extension which might
or might not be available on a deployment.  Instead of always
specifying distributed=False, just leave it to be the default.

Closes-Bug: #1707556
Change-Id: Ifb38acb3c80ead929e6e24112d31dedc757118fb

subject: Add int storage of datetime for password created/expires
revisions:
[{'number': 9, 'created': '2017-08-15 18:34:20.000000000', 'files': ['keystone/common/sql/contract_repo/versions/024_contract_create_created_at_int_columns.py', 'releasenotes/notes/bug-1702211-abb59adda73fd78e.yaml', 'requirements.txt', 'test-requirements.txt', 'keystone/common/sql/core.py', 'keystone/common/sql/data_migration_repo/versions/024_migrate_create_created_at_int_columns.py', 'keystone/identity/backends/sql_model.py', 'keystone/tests/unit/test_backend_sql.py', 'keystone/tests/unit/test_sql_upgrade.py', 'keystone/common/sql/expand_repo/versions/024_expand_create_created_at_int_columns.py', 'keystone/tests/unit/identity/test_backend_sql.py'], 'message': 'Add int storage of datetime for password created/expires

Due to MySQL (in some versions) not storing datetime resolution below
one second, keystone occasionally ends up with weird behavior such as
a New password not being valid. The password created at and expires at
columns now store both datetime (for rolling upgrades) and integers.

Keystone from Pike and beyond leans on the new created_at_int column
and expires_at_int column.

Change-Id: I2c219b4b9b353f1e2cce6088849a773196f0e443
Closes-Bug: #1702211
'}]
commit_message:
Add int storage of datetime for password created/expires

Due to MySQL (in some versions) not storing datetime resolution below
one second, keystone occasionally ends up with weird behavior such as
a New password not being valid. The password created at and expires at
columns now store both datetime (for rolling upgrades) and integers.

Keystone from Pike and beyond leans on the new created_at_int column
and expires_at_int column.

Change-Id: I2c219b4b9b353f1e2cce6088849a773196f0e443
Closes-Bug: #1702211

commit_message:
DNM - fs011: disable container pull/push

When running in OpenStack Infra, the container pull/push takes too
much time, see https://bugs.launchpad.net/bugs/1710938
this is an attempt to see how this work when we disable it.

1. The title of this chapter named “Create a domain, projects, users,

   domain.
2. Explain to users where the domain 'default' comes from because the

commit_message:
Add the step to create a domain

Two reasons for adding this step:
1. The title of this chapter named “Create a domain, projects, users,
   and roles”，but there is no step to introduce how to create a
   domain.
2. Explain to users where the domain 'default' comes from because the
   default domain is used in later steps.

Change-Id: I5b627ce15f94f18fd538866a32b84e540090bfff
Closes-Bug: 1707130

subject: Disable facts on publish-openstack-artifacts jobs
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-08-16 15:59:31.000000000', 'files': ['playbooks/publish/openstack-artifacts.yaml'], 'message': "Disable facts on publish-openstack-artifacts jobs

While we do have fact caching enabled by default, they are not shared
across job runs. So, if we are doing add_host: tarballs.o.o each time
we upload something, it might be over kill to do gather facts each
time.

Right now, we don't use any facts, so we can stop collecting them.

Change-Id: I4a34c0c9c48b586dc24cb512c3a735e987deafbf
Signed-off-by: Paul Belanger <pabelanger@redhat.com>
"}]
commit_message:
Disable facts on publish-openstack-artifacts jobs

While we do have fact caching enabled by default, they are not shared
across job runs. So, if we are doing add_host: tarballs.o.o each time
we upload something, it might be over kill to do gather facts each
time.

Right now, we don't use any facts, so we can stop collecting them.

Change-Id: I4a34c0c9c48b586dc24cb512c3a735e987deafbf
Signed-off-by: Paul Belanger <pabelanger@redhat.com>

due to the fact that CompareOpenStackReleases is not present in the

Change-Id: I6ac9be8041791df2404369ba5e8cb5e4e18aaf4d
Closes-Bug: #1658105

commit_message:
Enable LBaaS2 in Horizon

Install the python-neutron-lbaas-dashboard package if Ocata or greater
to enable LBaas2 in Horizon.

This fix is for stable/17.02 only as a mere cherry-pick is not possible
due to the fact that CompareOpenStackReleases is not present in the
stable charm-helpers branch at the time of writing.

There is no harm in doing a fix specifically for this branch with the
old style of comparison.

Change-Id: I6ac9be8041791df2404369ba5e8cb5e4e18aaf4d
Closes-Bug: #1658105

subject: Manually check apparmor_status
revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2017-08-16 14:03:29.000000000', 'files': ['run_tests.sh', 'bindep.txt', 'Vagrantfile', 'tasks/rhel7stig/lsm.yml'], 'message': "Manually check apparmor_status

The apparmor systemd unit file simply calls an old SysV init script
to load AppArmor profiles. The init script exits and systemd has no
idea if it's still running or not. This causes Ansible to start
the apparmor unit each time the playbook runs, which breaks the
idempotency checks.

This patch checks the apparmor_status output directly to see what the
status of AppArmor actually is. If the module is loaded, then we
should not try to start AppArmor with the unit file again.

This patch also includes the updates from the openstack-ansible-tests
repository that were included in
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/488489/ so that the gate can be
unblocked.

Partial-Bug: 1710675
Change-Id: If253714d0ca4b5a3d324255751e6f6615ca75dde
"}]
commit_message:
Manually check apparmor_status

The apparmor systemd unit file simply calls an old SysV init script
to load AppArmor profiles. The init script exits and systemd has no
idea if it's still running or not. This causes Ansible to start
the apparmor unit each time the playbook runs, which breaks the
idempotency checks.

This patch checks the apparmor_status output directly to see what the
status of AppArmor actually is. If the module is loaded, then we
should not try to start AppArmor with the unit file again.

This patch also includes the updates from the openstack-ansible-tests
repository that were included in
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/488489/ so that the gate can be
unblocked.

Partial-Bug: 1710675
Change-Id: If253714d0ca4b5a3d324255751e6f6615ca75dde

subject: Add target attribute to RPC endpoint class
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-08-09 14:53:57.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/plugins/ml2/drivers/openvswitch/agent/ovs_neutron_agent.py'], 'message': "Add target attribute to RPC endpoint class

oslo.messaging expects that if a 'target' attribute is present in an
endpoint it must be of type Target and specify a method filter.
SinkHole returns a method on any attribute access, which causes
oslo.messaging to fail when a SinkHole method is accessed.

Change-Id: I1568503c7b365e818861dc8b5f605eaa2d0e1f54
Closes-Bug: 1709625
Related-Bug: 1709131
Related-Bug: 1705351
"}]
commit_message:
Add target attribute to RPC endpoint class

oslo.messaging expects that if a 'target' attribute is present in an
endpoint it must be of type Target and specify a method filter.
SinkHole returns a method on any attribute access, which causes
oslo.messaging to fail when a SinkHole method is accessed.

Change-Id: I1568503c7b365e818861dc8b5f605eaa2d0e1f54
Closes-Bug: 1709625
Related-Bug: 1709131
Related-Bug: 1705351

commit_message:
Create site_zuulv3_dev secret

This creates a new secret containing information about zuulv3-dev.o.o. SSH
user, FQDN, SSH known_hosts and SSH private key.

Job publish-openstack-artifacts also needs access to site_zuulv3_dev
secret.

This was encrypted using:

  tools/encrypt_secret.py --infile zuulv3_dev_id_rsa http://zuulv3.openstack.org gerrit openstack-infra/project-config

Change-Id: I37add28e250875a0217ac061c3263c8d9c3832b6
Signed-off-by: Paul Belanger <pabelanger@redhat.com>

subject: Sync neutron db with OVN southbound db
revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2017-08-16 11:27:13.000000000', 'files': ['networking_ovn/cmd/neutron_ovn_db_sync_util.py', 'networking_ovn/ovn_db_sync.py', 'networking_ovn/l3/l3_ovn.py', 'networking_ovn/tests/unit/cmd/test_neutron_ovn_db_sync_util.py'], 'message': 'Sync neutron db with OVN southbound db

Presently we do not sync neutron db with OVN southbound db.
This patch does that. Also when an existing Neutron ML2 OVS
deployment is migrated to OVN, there could be router ports
of type DVR and HA. We need to consider these router port types
during sync.

Change-Id: I8628b32f70aa98d45cb340839aace180cf1d9c80
Closes-bug: #1629076
Co-authored-by: Dong Jun <dongj@dtdream.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Sync neutron db with OVN southbound db

Presently we do not sync neutron db with OVN southbound db.
This patch does that. Also when an existing Neutron ML2 OVS
deployment is migrated to OVN, there could be router ports
of type DVR and HA. We need to consider these router port types
during sync.

Change-Id: I8628b32f70aa98d45cb340839aace180cf1d9c80
Closes-bug: #1629076
Co-authored-by: Dong Jun <dongj@dtdream.com>

commit_message:
Render VIPs dynamically based on network_data.yaml

This change modifies the templates to dynamically define the VIPs
based on network_data.yaml. If a network is defined and marked
with "vip: true" in network_data.yaml, it will be included in the
overcloud.yaml which defines the deployment-level resources.

This should make it possible to create custom networks and
use them for services which use high-availability through VIPs.

Also, extraconfig/nova_metadata/krb-service-pricipals.yaml
was modified to dynamically produce the FQDN map for VIPs on
isolated networks, to match overcloud.j2.yaml.

Depends-On: If074f87494a46305c990a0ea332c7b576d3c6ed8
Depends-On: Iab8aca2f1fcaba0c8f109717a4b3068f629c9aab
Partially-implements: blueprint composable-networks
Closes-bug: 1667104
Change-Id: I71339a6ac41133e95dbc3f93abb7a9fdeb0f2da0

commit_message:
Update amulet tests for internal-dns

Upate amulet tests to check for internal-dns ml2 enablement.
This change enables ml2-internal-dns for all supported
deployments (>= mitaka) and validates the config and relation
data.

subject: jenkins: jobs: ansible-role-jobs: Increase job timeout to 90 minutes
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-08-15 18:59:58.000000000', 'files': ['jenkins/jobs/ansible-role-jobs.yaml'], 'message': 'jenkins: jobs: ansible-role-jobs: Increase job timeout to 90 minutes

We are seeing a lot of failures lately due to job timeouts. It appears
that jobs got more complex over time so these timeouts do not
necessarily mean that the job is stuck. For example the following job

2017-08-15 15:08:55.607415 | [Zuul] Launched by zl07
[...]
2017-08-15 16:03:01.405355 | TASK [Run functional tests for swift] ******************************************
2017-08-15 16:03:01.428393 | Tuesday 15 August 2017  16:03:01 +0000 (0:00:00.062)       0:51:42.612 ********
2017-08-15 16:14:02.430223 | [Zuul] Job timed out, result: FAILURE

took about an hour to reach the point of actually executing the
functional tests so the failure does not look legit. As such it might
be better to increase the timeout again so we can give the CI jobs more
time to finish.

Change-Id: I3562263beb5d3b8b3e164f96ae48f2cb2dddace5
'}]
commit_message:
jenkins: jobs: ansible-role-jobs: Increase job timeout to 90 minutes

We are seeing a lot of failures lately due to job timeouts. It appears
that jobs got more complex over time so these timeouts do not
necessarily mean that the job is stuck. For example the following job

2017-08-15 15:08:55.607415 | [Zuul] Launched by zl07
[...]
2017-08-15 16:03:01.405355 | TASK [Run functional tests for swift] ******************************************
2017-08-15 16:03:01.428393 | Tuesday 15 August 2017  16:03:01 +0000 (0:00:00.062)       0:51:42.612 ********
2017-08-15 16:14:02.430223 | [Zuul] Job timed out, result: FAILURE

took about an hour to reach the point of actually executing the
functional tests so the failure does not look legit. As such it might
be better to increase the timeout again so we can give the CI jobs more
time to finish.

Change-Id: I3562263beb5d3b8b3e164f96ae48f2cb2dddace5

revisions:
[{'number': 6, 'created': '2017-08-14 01:03:28.000000000', 'files': ['tripleoclient/v1/container_image.py', 'tripleoclient/tests/v1/overcloud_image/test_container_image.py'], 'message': 'Add --set argument to prepare command

This new argument will allow special ceph variables to be added to the
template file overcloud_containers.yaml.j2. For example if the
following existed in the template file:
  {% set ceph_namespace=ceph_namespace or "ceph" %}
  {% set ceph_daemon=ceph_daemon or "daemon" %}
  {% set ceph_tag=ceph_tag or "tag-build-master-jewel-centos-7" %}
  - imagename: "{{ ceph_namespace }}/{{ ceph_daemon }}:{{ ceph_tag }}"

Then the --set argument will allow making substitutions on these
values, for example:

      --namespace tripleoupstream \
      --tag latest \
      --images-file overcloud_containers.yaml \
      --set ceph_namespace=myceph \
      --set ceph_tag=latest \
      --env-file $HOME/docker_registry.yaml

Change-Id: Ie12dbab0f4d7f20d14a764abb9095fd8b326c700
'}]
commit_message:
Add --set argument to prepare command

This new argument will allow special ceph variables to be added to the
template file overcloud_containers.yaml.j2. For example if the
following existed in the template file:
  {% set ceph_namespace=ceph_namespace or "ceph" %}
  {% set ceph_daemon=ceph_daemon or "daemon" %}
  {% set ceph_tag=ceph_tag or "tag-build-master-jewel-centos-7" %}
  - imagename: "{{ ceph_namespace }}/{{ ceph_daemon }}:{{ ceph_tag }}"

Then the --set argument will allow making substitutions on these
values, for example:
  openstack overcloud container image prepare \
      --namespace tripleoupstream \
      --tag latest \
      --images-file overcloud_containers.yaml \
      --set ceph_namespace=myceph \
      --set ceph_tag=latest \
      --env-file $HOME/docker_registry.yaml

Change-Id: Ie12dbab0f4d7f20d14a764abb9095fd8b326c700

The TempURL resource is meant to create Swift temporary URL
resources. The only action it really implements is _create(),
as it happens with RandomString to which it is very similar

Change-Id: I8f819a8a53850cb0952865d3b43049682b1c44e3

commit_message:
Add OS::Swift::TempURL resource

The TempURL resource is meant to create Swift temporary URL
resources. The only action it really implements is _create(),
as it happens with RandomString to which it is very similar
as it simply outputs a temporary URL built from the needed
properties, doesn't create any actual resource in Swift except
for setting a secret on the published object.

Change-Id: I8f819a8a53850cb0952865d3b43049682b1c44e3

subject: Add test the exposes duplicate roles in token
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2017-08-16 01:32:52.000000000', 'files': ['keystone/tests/unit/test_v3_federation.py'], 'message': "Add test the exposes duplicate roles in token

This is a WIP test case that attempts to recreate an issue with
duplication of role assignments. In federated cases, it's been
observed that a token scoped to a project might contain the same role
twice. It doesn't make sense to return
role: [{'name': 'member'}, {'name': 'member'}] when once is enough.

This is possible because federated tokens are populated with roles
implied through groups (e.g. the mapping) and they can also consist
of direct role assignments via the shadow user concept.

Part of the problem is that this appears to be a transient issue.
I can run the test case multiple times but it doesn't fail
consistently.

Change-Id: I4e20a77b6bbb751d0f1c462930c48e803c8e6a48
Related-Bug: 1701324
"}]
commit_message:
Add test the exposes duplicate roles in token

This is a WIP test case that attempts to recreate an issue with
duplication of role assignments. In federated cases, it's been
observed that a token scoped to a project might contain the same role
twice. It doesn't make sense to return
role: [{'name': 'member'}, {'name': 'member'}] when once is enough.

This is possible because federated tokens are populated with roles
implied through groups (e.g. the mapping) and they can also consist
of direct role assignments via the shadow user concept.

Part of the problem is that this appears to be a transient issue.
I can run the test case multiple times but it doesn't fail
consistently.

Change-Id: I4e20a77b6bbb751d0f1c462930c48e803c8e6a48
Related-Bug: 1701324

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 10608, 'name': 'Matthew Edmonds', 'email': 'edmondsw@us.ibm.com', 'username': 'edmondsw'}, {'_account_id': 14070, 'name': 'Eric Fried', 'email': 'openstack@fried.cc', 'username': 'efried'}, {'_account_id': 16128, 'name': 'IBM PowerVM CI', 'email': 'powervmci@linux.vnet.ibm.com', 'username': 'powervmci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 19930, 'name': 'Dai Dang Van', 'email': 'daikk115@gmail.com', 'username': 'daidv'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-06-14 07:49:17.000000000', 'files': ['networking_powervm/plugins/ibm/agent/powervm/prov_req.py'], 'message': 'Replace six.iteritems() with .items()

1.As mentioned in [1], we should avoid usingg
six.iteritems to achieve iterators. We can
use dict.items instead, as it will return
iterators in PY3 as well. And dict.items/keys
will more readable. 2.In py2, the performance
about list should be negligible, see the link [2].
[1] https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Python3
[2] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2015-June/066391.html

Change-Id: I4b541390f6101619ed43cfdf24d9c693413cc853
'}]
commit_message:
Replace six.iteritems() with .items()

1.As mentioned in [1], we should avoid usingg
six.iteritems to achieve iterators. We can
use dict.items instead, as it will return
iterators in PY3 as well. And dict.items/keys
will more readable. 2.In py2, the performance
about list should be negligible, see the link [2].
[1] https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Python3
[2] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2015-June/066391.html

Change-Id: I4b541390f6101619ed43cfdf24d9c693413cc853

commit_message:
Update doc related to Fedora img url

When enabling heat service with devstack,it can not download
the fedora img. The fedora image url of
Fedora-Cloud-Base-24-1.2.x86 has been updated.

Due to the outdated fedora img url, the location of HOT file
has been changed when creeating your first stack.The corresp-
onding changes will happen in heat-templates.

subject: Modify variable's usage in Log Messages
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-03-09 06:49:10.000000000', 'files': ['heat/common/urlfetch.py'], 'message': "Modify variable's usage in Log Messages

String interpolation should be delayed to be handled by the logging code,
rather than being done at the point of the logging call.
Ref:http://docs.openstack.org/developer/oslo.i18n/guidelines.html#adding-variables-to-log-messages
For example:
WRONG:  LOG.info(_LI('some message: variable=%s') % variable)
RIRHT:  LOG.info(_LI('some message: variable=%s'), variable)

Change-Id: Iae618c2edf767cd965b4e512a08ef0cb6ef81b86
"}]
commit_message:
Modify variable's usage in Log Messages

String interpolation should be delayed to be handled by the logging code,
rather than being done at the point of the logging call.
Ref:http://docs.openstack.org/developer/oslo.i18n/guidelines.html#adding-variables-to-log-messages
For example:
WRONG:  LOG.info(_LI('some message: variable=%s') % variable)
RIRHT:  LOG.info(_LI('some message: variable=%s'), variable)

Change-Id: Iae618c2edf767cd965b4e512a08ef0cb6ef81b86

and take more resources than `while`. Let use `while` instead of it.

subject: Only run json.dump once
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2017-08-15 12:39:38.000000000', 'files': ['transform.py'], 'message': "Only run json.dump once

Rather than dump twice, once for each file, dump once to a variable.
Then, while we've got it in memory, strip trailing spaces. It's not
required that json output have no trailing spaces, but gerrit shows them
as does vim when opening files to look at them. It's easy to rememdy,
and we're rolling out some file updates in the next patch anyway.

Change-Id: Id3d04655264480b202a58b93a813360003707508
"}]
commit_message:
Only run json.dump once

Rather than dump twice, once for each file, dump once to a variable.
Then, while we've got it in memory, strip trailing spaces. It's not
required that json output have no trailing spaces, but gerrit shows them
as does vim when opening files to look at them. It's easy to rememdy,
and we're rolling out some file updates in the next patch anyway.

Change-Id: Id3d04655264480b202a58b93a813360003707508

2.In py2, the performance about list should be negligible, see the

commit_message:
Replace six.iteritems() with .items()

1.As mentioned in [1], we should avoid using six.iteritems to achieve
iterators. We can use dict.items instead, as it will return iterators
in PY3 as well. And dict.items/keys will more readable.
2.In py2, the performance about list should be negligible, see the
link [2].
[1] https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Python3
[2] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2015-June/066391.html

Change-Id: I2d0ac71260d317b2ddb380934e3d8a5a84e1504b

commit_message:
Remove unused docker-centos-tripleoupstream.yaml

The file was consumed in CI until it was able to generate a proper
environment file with the `openstack overcloud container image prepare`
command. This is now the case thanks to
I6a5796428c224584359b2a434d7fc80878d5f038 and the file is not necessary
anymore.

Change-Id: Id8d3f88a9804b5b25b440ae027f9552bad0e122f

subject: Workaround non-compatible type.adapt() for SQLAlchemy < 1.1
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-08-10 21:24:12.000000000', 'files': ['oslo_db/sqlalchemy/ndb.py', 'oslo_db/sqlalchemy/compat/utils.py'], 'message': 'Workaround non-compatible type.adapt() for SQLAlchemy < 1.1

The ndb change that makes use of String.adapt() to produce a new
object breaks on SQLAlchemy < 1.1 because adapt() there does
not allow for kwargs to override those already
present in the type.

Change-Id: I8cc79dc9bebcb3cb3accf76559bc969c2dae7ed9
'}]
commit_message:
Workaround non-compatible type.adapt() for SQLAlchemy < 1.1

The ndb change that makes use of String.adapt() to produce a new
object breaks on SQLAlchemy < 1.1 because adapt() there does
not allow for kwargs to override those already
present in the type.

Change-Id: I8cc79dc9bebcb3cb3accf76559bc969c2dae7ed9

commit_message:
documentation: Document how to install services

Up until now, if people wanted to deploy using services, they pretty
much had to resort to reading what we do in the devstack plugin. Now it
is documented explaining the main way to do it as well as an
alternative.

Implements: blueprint octavia-support
Change-Id: I72b55569767a965d4010150a51731e4da75f4712
Signed-off-by: Antoni Segura Puimedon <antonisp@celebdor.com>

subject: Support for L3 gateway HA
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 1561, 'name': 'Russell Bryant', 'email': 'rbryant@redhat.com', 'username': 'russellb'}, {'_account_id': 6773, 'name': 'Lucas Alvares Gomes', 'email': 'lucasagomes@gmail.com', 'username': 'lucasagomes'}, {'_account_id': 8788, 'name': 'Miguel Angel Ajo', 'email': 'mangelajo@redhat.com', 'username': 'mangelajo'}, {'_account_id': 8871, 'name': 'Elastic Recheck', 'username': 'elasticrecheck'}, {'_account_id': 8873, 'name': 'Assaf Muller', 'email': 'amuller@redhat.com', 'username': 'amuller'}, {'_account_id': 10237, 'name': 'Numan Siddique', 'email': 'nusiddiq@redhat.com', 'username': 'numansiddique'}, {'_account_id': 10267, 'name': 'venkata anil', 'email': 'anilvenkata@redhat.com', 'username': 'anil'}, {'_account_id': 23630, 'name': 'Tovin Seven', 'email': 'tovin07@gmail.com', 'username': 'tovin07'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 11, 'created': '2017-08-16 07:09:36.000000000', 'files': ['networking_ovn/common/ovn_client.py', 'networking_ovn/ovsdb/impl_idl_ovn.py', 'networking_ovn/tests/functional/test_router.py', 'networking_ovn/ovsdb/commands.py', 'networking_ovn/tests/unit/l3/test_l3_ovn_scheduler.py', 'networking_ovn/tests/unit/ovsdb/test_impl_idl_ovn.py', 'networking_ovn/tests/unit/l3/test_l3_ovn.py', 'networking_ovn/l3/l3_ovn.py', 'networking_ovn/l3/l3_ovn_scheduler.py'], 'message': "Support for L3 gateway HA

Recently L3 gateway HA support added in OVN making
distributed gateway ports highly available. This
patch makes neutron gateway ports highly available
through OVN distributed gateway ports.

If multiple gateway chassis available for scheduling as candidates,
then this patch schedules router gateway port on max of 5 chassis.
If only one gateway chassis is available, it schedules on only this
chassis.

If NBDB supports new schema to represent gateway_chassis i.e
1) gateway_chassis column in logical_router_port table
2) and Gateway_Chassis table
router gateway port is scheduled based on this new schema, otherwise old
schema is used. If existing router gateway ports are already using old
schema, this patch still supports that and won't convert them to new
schema.

Change-Id: I56c28237b19a6ae01f8567d12580661bcca43ba7
"}]
commit_message:
Support for L3 gateway HA

Recently L3 gateway HA support added in OVN making
distributed gateway ports highly available. This
patch makes neutron gateway ports highly available
through OVN distributed gateway ports.

If multiple gateway chassis available for scheduling as candidates,
then this patch schedules router gateway port on max of 5 chassis.
If only one gateway chassis is available, it schedules on only this
chassis.

If NBDB supports new schema to represent gateway_chassis i.e
1) gateway_chassis column in logical_router_port table
2) and Gateway_Chassis table
router gateway port is scheduled based on this new schema, otherwise old
schema is used. If existing router gateway ports are already using old
schema, this patch still supports that and won't convert them to new
schema.

Change-Id: I56c28237b19a6ae01f8567d12580661bcca43ba7

commit_message:
Ability to manage domain config seperately

This change allows a user of the heat::keystone::domain class to manage
the user creation seperately from the user configuration for the heat
services.

Previously one could disable the management of the users but could not
prevent the configuration file from being updated if all they wanted to
do was create the users.

Change-Id: Iab8204d3dfd727149d41ad86616a8f95a6f720dc
(cherry picked from commit 08488e3686850ad4f8615a6df701e265b8f22ca2)

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-08-15 14:01:08.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/volume/drivers/netapp/dataontap/utils/capabilities.py'], 'message': 'NetApp: Fix SVM scoped user startup exception

Due to an issue discovered in certain versions of ONTAP the driver may
not start for a SVM scoped user. When this error occurs an exception is
raised, by the driver, that includes the text "User not permitted to
query Data ONTAP volumes". The bug fix resolves this issue for a SVM
scoped user that has the correct role assigned (i.e. vsadmin).

Change-Id: Ic000ba6694eca72ae78437f7d773277fd67b0395
Closes-Bug: #1705738
(cherry picked from commit 158ccc7836f1aad0514767d53c9805e681463f4b)
'}]
commit_message:
NetApp: Fix SVM scoped user startup exception

Due to an issue discovered in certain versions of ONTAP the driver may
not start for a SVM scoped user. When this error occurs an exception is
raised, by the driver, that includes the text "User not permitted to
query Data ONTAP volumes". The bug fix resolves this issue for a SVM
scoped user that has the correct role assigned (i.e. vsadmin).

Change-Id: Ic000ba6694eca72ae78437f7d773277fd67b0395
Closes-Bug: #1705738
(cherry picked from commit 158ccc7836f1aad0514767d53c9805e681463f4b)

subject: Fix keystone, cinder, heat-api cron containers
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 360, 'name': 'Dan Prince', 'email': 'dprince@redhat.com', 'username': 'dan-prince'}, {'_account_id': 2011, 'name': 'Ian Main', 'email': 'imain@redhat.com', 'username': 'imain'}, {'_account_id': 4571, 'name': 'Steve Baker', 'email': 'sbaker@redhat.com', 'username': 'steve-stevebaker'}, {'_account_id': 6926, 'name': 'Bogdan Dobrelya', 'email': 'bdobreli@redhat.com', 'username': 'bogdando'}, {'_account_id': 8042, 'name': 'Jiří Stránský', 'email': 'jistr@redhat.com', 'username': 'jistr'}, {'_account_id': 13039, 'name': 'Martin André', 'email': 'm.andre@redhat.com', 'username': 'mandre'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2017-08-01 14:06:55.000000000', 'files': ['docker/services/heat-api.yaml', 'docker/services/cinder-api.yaml', 'docker/services/keystone.yaml'], 'message': 'Fix keystone, cinder, heat-api cron containers

The cron containers need to run as root in order to create PID files
correctly.

Additionally, the keystone_cron container was misconfigured to
use /usr/bin/cron instead of the correct /usr/bin/crond.

Additionally we have an issue where the Kolla keystone container has
hard coded ARGS for the docker container which causes -DFOREGROUND
(an Apache specific argument) to get appended onto the kolla_start
command thus causing crond to fail to startup correctly. This
works around the issue by overriding the command and calling
kolla_set_configs manually. Once we fix this in Kolla we can
revisit this.

Change-Id: Ib8fb2bef9a3bb89131265051e9ea304525b58374
Related-bug: 1707785
'}]
commit_message:
Fix keystone, cinder, heat-api cron containers

The cron containers need to run as root in order to create PID files
correctly.

Additionally, the keystone_cron container was misconfigured to
use /usr/bin/cron instead of the correct /usr/bin/crond.

Additionally we have an issue where the Kolla keystone container has
hard coded ARGS for the docker container which causes -DFOREGROUND
(an Apache specific argument) to get appended onto the kolla_start
command thus causing crond to fail to startup correctly. This
works around the issue by overriding the command and calling
kolla_set_configs manually. Once we fix this in Kolla we can
revisit this.

Change-Id: Ib8fb2bef9a3bb89131265051e9ea304525b58374
Related-bug: 1707785

commit_message:
Add dependency on linuxbridge agent service to network service

VLAN device defined in /etc/sysconfig/network-script/
is not reattached to bridge after restart network service.
So, linux bridge agent needs to be restarted after network service.

Change-Id: I756fdb7958dbd747834b0c1d67d7d03b1c3cca4d
Signed-off-by: heetae82.ahn <heetae82.ahn@samsung.com>

subject: Fix reloads for uWSGI
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-08-15 16:35:34.000000000', 'files': ['templates/cinder-uwsgi.ini.j2', 'templates/cinder-systemd-init.j2'], 'message': 'Fix reloads for uWSGI

uWSGI won't reload properly unless we use one of the built in options
for uWSGI reloads:

touch-reload
pidfile reload using uwsgi binary

This opts to use the pid file option, which uses the built in uWSGI
--reload option along with the "pidfile" option specified in the conf
file to reload the service.

Change-Id: I9dbdd75f4ac555378e6999243718d2b986071dde
'}]
commit_message:
Fix reloads for uWSGI

uWSGI won't reload properly unless we use one of the built in options
for uWSGI reloads:

touch-reload
pidfile reload using uwsgi binary

This opts to use the pid file option, which uses the built in uWSGI
--reload option along with the "pidfile" option specified in the conf
file to reload the service.

Change-Id: I9dbdd75f4ac555378e6999243718d2b986071dde

commit_message:
Add dependency on linuxbridge agent service to network service

VLAN device defined in /etc/sysconfig/network-script/
is not reattached to bridge after restart network service.
So, linux bridge agent needs to be restarted after network service.

Change-Id: I756fdb7958dbd747834b0c1d67d7d03b1c3cca4d
Signed-off-by: heetae82.ahn <heetae82.ahn@samsung.com>

subject: Fix a bug in the profiler serializer.
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-08-16 05:28:27.000000000', 'files': ['vitrage/rpc.py'], 'message': 'Fix a bug in the profiler serializer.

The profiler serializer, which is used if the osprofiler is installed,
was initialized with None and therefore did not serialize the context.
As a result, the context did not reach the api handler layer and was
ignored.

The solution: if the serializer is None, return the un-serialized
context as is.

Change-Id: I6f9b3c3735b10229e5bfd61339632730d2d812d1
Closes-Bug: #1707589
'}]
commit_message:
Fix a bug in the profiler serializer.

The profiler serializer, which is used if the osprofiler is installed,
was initialized with None and therefore did not serialize the context.
As a result, the context did not reach the api handler layer and was
ignored.

The solution: if the serializer is None, return the un-serialized
context as is.

Change-Id: I6f9b3c3735b10229e5bfd61339632730d2d812d1
Closes-Bug: #1707589

subject: Acquire fails with "ToozError: Not found"
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 1297, 'name': 'Joshua Harlow', 'email': 'jxharlow@godaddy.com', 'username': 'harlowja'}, {'_account_id': 1669, 'name': 'Julien Danjou', 'display_name': 'jd', 'email': 'julien@danjou.info', 'username': 'jdanjou'}, {'_account_id': 8871, 'name': 'Elastic Recheck', 'username': 'elasticrecheck'}, {'_account_id': 9535, 'name': 'Gorka Eguileor', 'email': 'geguileo@redhat.com', 'username': 'Gorka'}, {'_account_id': 9796, 'name': 'ChangBo Guo', 'email': 'glongwave@gmail.com', 'username': 'gcb'}, {'_account_id': 16064, 'name': 'Mike Rooney', 'email': 'rooneym@netapp.com', 'username': 'rooneym'}, {'_account_id': 21129, 'name': 'Alan Bishop', 'email': 'abishop@redhat.com', 'username': 'ASBishop'}, {'_account_id': 22257, 'name': 'Manish', 'email': 'deolalkar.manish@hpe.com', 'username': 'manishd'}, {'_account_id': 22664, 'name': 'William Durairaj', 'email': 'william.dur.sandanaraj@hpe.com', 'username': 'william.durairaj'}, {'_account_id': 24952, 'name': 'Vivek Soni', 'email': 'viveksoni31390@gmail.com', 'username': 'sonivi'}, {'_account_id': 26379, 'name': 'Imran Ansari', 'email': 'imran.ansari@hpe.com', 'username': 'imran.ansari'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 6, 'created': '2017-08-14 16:59:09.000000000', 'files': ['tooz/drivers/etcd3gw.py'], 'message': 'Acquire fails with "ToozError: Not found"

For Etcd3Lock, blocking call to acquire an already acquired lock fails
when the thread/process, that acquired the lock takes more than the
timeout specified for the lock.

Scenario
========
1. First thread acquires a lock "Lock1"
2. Second thread tries to acquire "Lock1" with blocking=True
3. First thread releases lock after few minutes
4. Second thread tries to acquire it and fails with exception:
ToozError: Not found

Cause
=====
Lease gets created when the lock is created and the default timeout is
30 secs. Since the first thread takes more than 30 seconds to complete,
the lease for the second thread gets expired leading to "Not found"
message.

Resolution
==========
Create lease within Etcd3Lock.acquire() rather than
Etcd3Lock.__init__() of Etcd3Lock

Change-Id: Ief75675ebde2d824a25aec6210e2a868cf3dbbe7
Closes-Bug: #1708836
'}]
commit_message:
Acquire fails with "ToozError: Not found"

For Etcd3Lock, blocking call to acquire an already acquired lock fails
when the thread/process, that acquired the lock takes more than the
timeout specified for the lock.

Scenario
========
1. First thread acquires a lock "Lock1"
2. Second thread tries to acquire "Lock1" with blocking=True
3. First thread releases lock after few minutes
4. Second thread tries to acquire it and fails with exception:
ToozError: Not found

Cause
=====
Lease gets created when the lock is created and the default timeout is
30 secs. Since the first thread takes more than 30 seconds to complete,
the lease for the second thread gets expired leading to "Not found"
message.

Resolution
==========
Create lease within Etcd3Lock.acquire() rather than
Etcd3Lock.__init__() of Etcd3Lock

Change-Id: Ief75675ebde2d824a25aec6210e2a868cf3dbbe7
Closes-Bug: #1708836

commit_message:
Add NET_ADMIN capability to docker-puppet container

This is needed in order to run iptables from within the container.

This commit also removes an incorrect haproxy_config puppet tag that
doesn't exist in the puppetlabs-haproxy module.

Change-Id: Ic2cf930119e8930ea8be34cf90835c474a101f66
Closes-Bug: #1697684

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2017-08-12 01:21:13.000000000', 'files': ['nova/virt/libvirt/driver.py', 'nova/tests/unit/virt/libvirt/test_guest.py', 'nova/tests/unit/virt/test_virt_drivers.py', 'nova/virt/libvirt/guest.py', 'nova/tests/unit/virt/libvirt/test_driver.py'], 'message': 'libvirt: Check if domain is persistent before detaching devices

Previously the libvirt driver would always assume that it was only
detaching devices (volumes or virtual interfaces) from a persistent
domain however that is not always the case.

For example when rolling back from a live migration an attempt is made
to detach volumes from the transient destination domain that is being
cleaned up. This attempt would fail with the previous assumption of the
domain being persistent in place.

This change introduces a simple call to has_persistent_configuration
within detach_device_with_retry to confirm the state of the domain
before attempting to detach.

Closes-Bug: #1669857
Closes-Bug: #1696125
Change-Id: I95948721a0119f5f54dbe50d4455fd47d422164b
(cherry picked from commit 563c0927d14d052e3f1fad80df95fe4a7c48d38b)
(cherry picked from commit 00b7b714b37dbbaac8a3570541ecc6b75ce3a77f)
'}]
commit_message:
libvirt: Check if domain is persistent before detaching devices

Previously the libvirt driver would always assume that it was only
detaching devices (volumes or virtual interfaces) from a persistent
domain however that is not always the case.

For example when rolling back from a live migration an attempt is made
to detach volumes from the transient destination domain that is being
cleaned up. This attempt would fail with the previous assumption of the
domain being persistent in place.

This change introduces a simple call to has_persistent_configuration
within detach_device_with_retry to confirm the state of the domain
before attempting to detach.

Closes-Bug: #1669857
Closes-Bug: #1696125
Change-Id: I95948721a0119f5f54dbe50d4455fd47d422164b
(cherry picked from commit 563c0927d14d052e3f1fad80df95fe4a7c48d38b)
(cherry picked from commit 00b7b714b37dbbaac8a3570541ecc6b75ce3a77f)

Current code is reporting max over subscription using key
max_oversubscription_ration, which is incorrect.

Fix this and return over subscription with key
"max_over_subscription_ratio" as expected by the scheduler.

Closes-Bug: #1704787
Change-Id: Iccd7d134adc251df988240f6f38bee2e239333ce
'}]
commit_message:
Kamiario: Fix over subscription reporting

Current code is reporting max over subscription using key
max_oversubscription_ration, which is incorrect.

Fix this and return over subscription with key
"max_over_subscription_ratio" as expected by the scheduler.

Closes-Bug: #1704787
Change-Id: Iccd7d134adc251df988240f6f38bee2e239333ce

revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2017-08-07 09:33:49.000000000', 'files': ['devstack/lib/networking-ovn'], 'message': "Make Metadata agent independent from other config files

Right now we're starting metadata agent passing in neutron and ml2
config files. In multinode environments we can't assume that those
files will be present in compute nodes so this patch is adding the
necessary parameters to metadata config file so that it doesn't
depend on any more files.

Change-Id: Ibc7cc750f26bbbbb0fc5f63c3863ef5b3705ddd8
"}]
commit_message:
Make Metadata agent independent from other config files

Right now we're starting metadata agent passing in neutron and ml2
config files. In multinode environments we can't assume that those
files will be present in compute nodes so this patch is adding the
necessary parameters to metadata config file so that it doesn't
depend on any more files.

Change-Id: Ibc7cc750f26bbbbb0fc5f63c3863ef5b3705ddd8

revisions:

The glance_store project has bandit fully integrated into its
pep8 gate job. This patch adds bandit integration job so bandit

Change-Id: If50524348b04ff6f2b038e017b957fd5448b68f8
'}]
commit_message:
Add bandit integration job for glance_store

The glance_store project has bandit fully integrated into its
pep8 gate job. This patch adds bandit integration job so bandit
changes that may break glance_store are found first in bandit.

commit_message:
Add pypi-jobs to masakari and related projects

This patch add pypi-jobs and publish-to-pypi jobs to,
openstack/masakari

openstack/python-masakariclient

https://pypi.python.org and “openstackci” user has “Owner”
permissions.

subject: Skip additional tests for Cinder doc changes
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2017-08-14 17:06:01.000000000', 'files': ['zuul/layout.yaml'], 'message': "Skip additional tests for Cinder doc changes

We currently optimize docs or release note only changes so we
don't run long-running tests with no functional code changes.
This adds compliance, bandit, and compliance jobs to the exclusion
list as these fall into the same category of testing things that are
not affected.

Change-Id: I5c1d04d45bca9133b9c902a2c920ad2218c2d800
"}]
commit_message:
Skip additional tests for Cinder doc changes

We currently optimize docs or release note only changes so we
don't run long-running tests with no functional code changes.
This adds compliance, bandit, and compliance jobs to the exclusion
list as these fall into the same category of testing things that are
not affected.

Change-Id: I5c1d04d45bca9133b9c902a2c920ad2218c2d800

subject: Revert "Temporarily start using the public registry again"
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-08-14 17:54:45.000000000', 'files': ['jenkins/jobs/macros.yaml'], 'message': 'Revert "Temporarily start using the public registry again"

In 0b00bd6abd3478f9b904e5561338f7216d0e2911 we added back our npmrc
files pointing to our reverse proxy cache. Manual testing confirmed
it to be working. Lets start having our jobs do the same.

This reverts commit 26edd714613ffcf1c1436a335adbea656a9eb101.

Change-Id: Id308190ff0e938a4b010455275344aff3af3b2a6
Signed-off-by: Paul Belanger <pabelanger@redhat.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Revert "Temporarily start using the public registry again"

In 0b00bd6abd3478f9b904e5561338f7216d0e2911 we added back our npmrc
files pointing to our reverse proxy cache. Manual testing confirmed
it to be working. Lets start having our jobs do the same.

This reverts commit 26edd714613ffcf1c1436a335adbea656a9eb101.

Change-Id: Id308190ff0e938a4b010455275344aff3af3b2a6
Signed-off-by: Paul Belanger <pabelanger@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Add support for the openSUSE Leap distributions

Add support for the openSUSE Leap distributions. Nothing special is
required for this except adding the appropriate distro variables
file and also update the zypper cache before package installation. We
also had to apply the same virtualenv-tools fix similar to CentOS.

Change-Id: I8bbf0af1149e4c5ea39f82e4fa7be78578cf6a50

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2017-08-15 09:17:13.000000000', 'files': ['docker/nova/nova-compute/Dockerfile.j2', 'docker/ceilometer/ceilometer-compute/Dockerfile.j2'], 'message': 'libvirt should be installed from OS rather than pip

python-libvirt need be compiled with libvirt header. compiling
it with different libvirt header may be failed.

So better install python-libvirt from OS distro.

Closes-Bug: #1707841
Change-Id: I0d7bf1576aaf24fc7c60f49923e37a6a1afe9a8e
'}]
commit_message:
libvirt should be installed from OS rather than pip

python-libvirt need be compiled with libvirt header. compiling
it with different libvirt header may be failed.

So better install python-libvirt from OS distro.

Closes-Bug: #1707841
Change-Id: I0d7bf1576aaf24fc7c60f49923e37a6a1afe9a8e

Domain name is needed when using keystone v3 to create keystoneauth
session[1], otherwise the following error will be raised:

InvalidInput: Invalid input received: Expecting to find domain in
project - the server could not comply with the request since it is
either malformed or otherwise incorrect

[1]: https://docs.openstack.org/keystoneauth/latest/authentication-plugins.html#v3-identity-plugins

Change-Id: I557a7107b51ae4ffab15d045a4be6e3ed1940bd8
Closes-bug: #1710570
'}]
commit_message:
Add missing domain name to novaclient

Domain name is needed when using keystone v3 to create keystoneauth
session[1], otherwise the following error will be raised:

InvalidInput: Invalid input received: Expecting to find domain in
project - the server could not comply with the request since it is
either malformed or otherwise incorrect

[1]: https://docs.openstack.org/keystoneauth/latest/authentication-plugins.html#v3-identity-plugins

Change-Id: I557a7107b51ae4ffab15d045a4be6e3ed1940bd8
Closes-bug: #1710570

commit_message:
tasks: keystone_install: Fix virtualenv-tools issue on openSUSE

This is similar to I8a27bb268ea2e145ed113c652ab7846f6adc3f82

openSUSE is also suffering from the same virtualenv-tools issue so
we need to remove the existing python-2.7 symlink.

Link: https://github.com/fireteam/virtualenv-tools/issues/5
Related-Bug: #1637509
Partial-Bug: #1644629
Change-Id: I16ea455f8d9336237175e6c43f0b14713cf314d3

subject: Don't unregister on system/resource delete
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2017-08-14 12:47:56.000000000', 'files': ['releasenotes/notes/dont-unregister-on-delete-9708f7cbc73a0d2f.yaml', 'extraconfig/pre_deploy/rhel-registration/rhel-registration.yaml'], 'message': 'Don't unregister on system/resource delete

Don't unregister systems from the portal/satellite
when deleting from Heat. There are several reasons why
it's compelling to fix this behavior. See
https://bugs.launchpad.net/tripleo/+bug/1710144
for full information. The previous behavior can be triggered
by setting the DeleteOnRHELUnregistration parameter to "true".

Closes-Bug: #1710144
Change-Id: I909a6f7a049dc23fc27f2231a4893d428f06a1f1
'}]
commit_message:
Don't unregister on system/resource delete

Don't unregister systems from the portal/satellite
when deleting from Heat. There are several reasons why
it's compelling to fix this behavior. See
https://bugs.launchpad.net/tripleo/+bug/1710144
for full information. The previous behavior can be triggered
by setting the DeleteOnRHELUnregistration parameter to "true".

Closes-Bug: #1710144
Change-Id: I909a6f7a049dc23fc27f2231a4893d428f06a1f1

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2017-04-07 08:49:42.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/volume/drivers/rbd.py', 'cinder/tests/unit/volume/drivers/test_rbd.py'], 'message': "Consider clone depth when create volume from snapshot

cinder config:
    rbd_max_clone_depth = 2

Typical scenario:
    1.create a raw volume C1
    2.create volume C2 from C1 (clone depth is 1)
    3.create volume C3 from C2 (clone depth is 2)
    4.create snapshot S3 for volume C3
    5.create volume C4 from S3 (clone depth is 3,
      but we don't flatten volume from snapshot here)
    then the clone depth will grow unlimited.

Analysis；
    1.we ignore to check clone depth when create volume from snapshot

Solution:
    1.check clone depth when create volume from snapshot
    2.flatten the new volume from source snapshot if necessary

Change-Id: Id5117b313c21d56376a842c676ad7b3973564ea2
Closes-Bug: #1651364
"}]
commit_message:
Consider clone depth when create volume from snapshot

cinder config:
    rbd_max_clone_depth = 2

Typical scenario:
    1.create a raw volume C1
    2.create volume C2 from C1 (clone depth is 1)
    3.create volume C3 from C2 (clone depth is 2)
    4.create snapshot S3 for volume C3
    5.create volume C4 from S3 (clone depth is 3,
      but we don't flatten volume from snapshot here)
    then the clone depth will grow unlimited.

Analysis；
    1.we ignore to check clone depth when create volume from snapshot

Solution:
    1.check clone depth when create volume from snapshot
    2.flatten the new volume from source snapshot if necessary

Change-Id: Id5117b313c21d56376a842c676ad7b3973564ea2
Closes-Bug: #1651364

commit_message:
Add option ha_vrrp_health_check_interval for l3

option 'ha_vrrp_health_check_interval' is needed to fix split-brain
in HA router[1][2], we should add this to l3_agent.ini.

[1] https://bugs.launchpad.net/neutron/+bug/1365461
[2] https://bugs.launchpad.net/neutron/+bug/1375625
[3] https://docs.openstack.org/ocata/networking-guide/deploy-ovs-ha-vrrp.html#keepalived-vrrp-health-check

Change-Id: I3f38f09068c17e3ed790611ffe5e445d14318cd1
Closes-bug: #1698992

subject: Fix a bug in the profiler serializer.
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-08-15 15:51:27.000000000', 'files': ['vitrage/rpc.py'], 'message': 'Fix a bug in the profiler serializer.

The profiler serializer, which is used if the osprofiler is installed,
was initialized with None and therefore did not serialize the context.
As a result, the context did not reach the api handler layer and was
ignored.

The solution: if the serializer is None, return the un-serialized
context as is.

Change-Id: I2317cff4014db2b4e437b2e9428bd936518d7ba8
Closes-Bug: #1707589
'}]
commit_message:
Fix a bug in the profiler serializer.

The profiler serializer, which is used if the osprofiler is installed,
was initialized with None and therefore did not serialize the context.
As a result, the context did not reach the api handler layer and was
ignored.

The solution: if the serializer is None, return the un-serialized
context as is.

Change-Id: I2317cff4014db2b4e437b2e9428bd936518d7ba8
Closes-Bug: #1707589

commit_message:
Prevent regression of IP loss on MAC update

This adjusts the UTs to ensure MAC address updates
don't wipe out the original fixed IPs on a port if the
IPs weren't part of the update.

Change-Id: Ibd9ec8ece6678c837027b59c1154db872270e7be
Related-Bug: #1684038
(cherry picked from commit 233a68d27c0225bd461795c4418a9fed2fe11346)

subject: Fix cannot delete user's email addresses in the identity/user panel
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-08-09 20:37:09.000000000', 'files': ['openstack_dashboard/dashboards/identity/users/tests.py', 'openstack_dashboard/dashboards/identity/users/forms.py'], 'message': "Fix cannot delete user's email addresses in the identity/user panel

How to reproduce the bug:

P.S. Using the horizon master(pike) codebase

1) Login as an admin user
2) Click Identity and go to the Users panel
3) Create a user and put an email address with that user
4) Then edit this user to clear the email address.
5) Update the user and even though we have a green  banner(successful)
show up, the email address still viewable and do not disappear.

Closes Bug: #1573479

Change-Id: I0273d0c6d885c77f1f74bdc2ae6674d1e6539ac0
"}]
commit_message:
Fix cannot delete user's email addresses in the identity/user panel

How to reproduce the bug:

P.S. Using the horizon master(pike) codebase

1) Login as an admin user
2) Click Identity and go to the Users panel
3) Create a user and put an email address with that user
4) Then edit this user to clear the email address.
5) Update the user and even though we have a green  banner(successful)
show up, the email address still viewable and do not disappear.

Closes Bug: #1573479

Change-Id: I0273d0c6d885c77f1f74bdc2ae6674d1e6539ac0

revisions:
[{'number': 10, 'created': '2017-08-15 16:29:26.000000000', 'files': ['keystone/common/sql/contract_repo/versions/024_contract_create_created_at_int_columns.py', 'releasenotes/notes/bug-1702211-abb59adda73fd78e.yaml', 'requirements.txt', 'test-requirements.txt', 'keystone/common/sql/core.py', 'keystone/common/sql/data_migration_repo/versions/024_migrate_create_created_at_int_columns.py', 'keystone/identity/backends/sql_model.py', 'keystone/tests/unit/test_backend_sql.py', 'keystone/tests/unit/test_sql_upgrade.py', 'keystone/common/sql/expand_repo/versions/024_expand_create_created_at_int_columns.py', 'keystone/tests/unit/identity/test_backend_sql.py'], 'message': 'Add int storage of datetime for password created/expires

Due to MySQL (in some versions) not storing datetime resolution below
one second, keystone occasionally ends up with weird behavior such as
a New password not being valid. The password created at and expires at
columns now store both datetime (for rolling upgrades) and integers.

Keystone from Pike and beyond leans on the new created_at_int column
and expires_at_int column.

Change-Id: I2c219b4b9b353f1e2cce6088849a773196f0e443
Closes-Bug: #1702211
'}]
commit_message:
Add int storage of datetime for password created/expires

Due to MySQL (in some versions) not storing datetime resolution below
one second, keystone occasionally ends up with weird behavior such as
a New password not being valid. The password created at and expires at
columns now store both datetime (for rolling upgrades) and integers.

Keystone from Pike and beyond leans on the new created_at_int column
and expires_at_int column.

Change-Id: I2c219b4b9b353f1e2cce6088849a773196f0e443
Closes-Bug: #1702211

subject: Stop loading OVOServerRpcInterface in ML2 testcase
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 7787, 'name': 'Kevin Benton', 'email': 'kevin@benton.pub', 'username': 'blak111'}, {'_account_id': 9656, 'name': 'Ihar Hrachyshka', 'email': 'ihrachys@redhat.com', 'username': 'ihrachys', 'status': 'Red Hat Networking Systems Engineer'}, {'_account_id': 9732, 'name': 'Mellanox CI', 'email': 'mlnx-openstack-ci@dev.mellanox.co.il', 'username': 'mellanox', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-08-11 11:33:16.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/tests/unit/plugins/ml2/test_plugin.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/plugins/ml2/test_ovo_rpc.py'], 'message': 'Stop loading OVOServerRpcInterface in ML2 testcase

This RPC notifier has an asynchronous handler that does DB lookups
to send notifications after an object has been created. Not only
is this a waste of resources in unit tests, it interferes with tests
that are inspecting the DB queries that occur between calls.

This just blocks the OVOServerRpcInterface in the ML2 test case and
then enables it for the set of unit tests that needs it.

Change-Id: I807e2445da9be241c24d8b6e5bda8b12927aa7fc
Closes-Bug: #1679775
(cherry picked from commit 9c4395965158e066becdb84cf30ea5f0e63e7cbc)
'}]
commit_message:
Stop loading OVOServerRpcInterface in ML2 testcase

This RPC notifier has an asynchronous handler that does DB lookups
to send notifications after an object has been created. Not only
is this a waste of resources in unit tests, it interferes with tests
that are inspecting the DB queries that occur between calls.

This just blocks the OVOServerRpcInterface in the ML2 test case and
then enables it for the set of unit tests that needs it.

Change-Id: I807e2445da9be241c24d8b6e5bda8b12927aa7fc
Closes-Bug: #1679775
(cherry picked from commit 9c4395965158e066becdb84cf30ea5f0e63e7cbc)

commit_message:
Make net_config ChoiceField themable

Now net_config ChoiceField option value is null, this will cause create
env network filed always gives error: This filed is required.

This patch make net_config ChoiceField themable, will fix this error.

Change-Id: Iaf9b37dd9a2bdc8acffe911399d3e73641460349
Closes-Bug: #1710557
(cherry picked from commit e7e99b39fc5927921156a0676a4b19ba0b56458b)

commit_message:
Allow customising of distro / flavor in install.sh

The install.sh script currently has custom logic depending on the flavor
of the base image being used, e.g. redhat/debian/etc.

Allow the user to specify the flavor of their base image in the case
that it can't be automatically determined from /etc/*release.

Change-Id: Iaf7cec9000a2ed2ca253bc95689122119bd5745a

commit_message:
Refactor the current UpdatePort form to workflow version

This patch change UpdatePort form to workflow in order to
be able to add extra tabs like the setting of security groups.
Originally, this work is a part of the subsequent patch
"Support security groups association per port",
but the changes are big so it is divided into two patches.
This patch focuses on refactoring the existing implementation
from the form to the workflow.

Change-Id: Id42b311242b66ee25e8870ed86e45b5464e19c01
Co-Authored-By: Akihiro Motoki <amotoki@gmail.com>
Related-bug: #1637444

commit_message:
Add missing correlation type "mpls" to port pair

Add missing correlation type "mpls" to Port Pair create
command's help (PortPairCreate).

The merged Port Pair command was still using the older help
description, before MPLS correlation support was merged to
networking-sfc.

Also add unit test coverage for correlation type "mpls".

Closes-Bug: #1708968
Change-Id: I708345b25b600ca94504725f1559988ae29413b8
(cherry picked from commit ff86783fd4345b1f4cd9ebc3cb90eadca3f2a261)

Current gate runs with kernel 4.4.0-89. Creating conntrack entries fails
with this version and leaves conntrack in stuck state leading to
functional tests to hang.

This patch proposes to skip those tests that create conntrack entries so

commit_message:
functional: disable netlink tests

Current gate runs with kernel 4.4.0-89. Creating conntrack entries fails
with this version and leaves conntrack in stuck state leading to
functional tests to hang.

This patch proposes to skip those tests that create conntrack entries so
we can enable back the functional job to voting to avoid new regressions
at this suite.

Change-Id: I9f883cea1d101efe6a7214c3a9b679fc32427365
Related-bug: #1709032

Now api of creating a snapshot in cinder is using volume transfer
description for 'name' and 'id' in creating volume snapshot parameters.

commit_message:
Don't special case Grenade + systemd

Now that the pike branch exists we don't want to special case grenade +
system on the target side. We should use systemd for both sides of the
pike -> master upgrade. Note this change should not be backported so
that we do not attempt to use systemd on the ocata -> pike upgrade path.

Depends-On: Iedf824a1772115e0dff287a898636f8e58471269
Change-Id: I6198bf1842a44773fce80672c81eee3afc3c6f38

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2017-08-08 16:04:00.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/unit/virt/libvirt/test_guest.py', 'nova/virt/libvirt/guest.py'], 'message': "Detach device from live domain even if not found on persistent

In a past attempt to fix a bug [1], we started raising DeviceNotFound
if a device wasn't found on the persistent domain. This was to address
a scenario where the guest ignored the detach from the live domain
because it was busy and we wanted to avoid failing a later detach
request to the user (compute handles DeviceNotFound).

Unfortunately, in the above case, a later detach request won't fail to
the user but it also won't detach from the live domain. It sees the
device already detached from the persistent domain and doesn't attempt
to detach from the live domain.

This is a serious problem because it's possible for a volume to be
attached to two live domains and data corruption can occur.

This adds an attempt to detach from the live domain even if we had
already detached from the persistent domain in the past.

Closes-Bug: #1707238

[1] https://review.openstack.org/386257

Change-Id: I8cd056fa17184a98c31547add0e9fb2d363d0908
(cherry picked from commit d39934ad6afb7e2729bb45235f363ada86012d15)
"}]
commit_message:
Detach device from live domain even if not found on persistent

In a past attempt to fix a bug [1], we started raising DeviceNotFound
if a device wasn't found on the persistent domain. This was to address
a scenario where the guest ignored the detach from the live domain
because it was busy and we wanted to avoid failing a later detach
request to the user (compute handles DeviceNotFound).

Unfortunately, in the above case, a later detach request won't fail to
the user but it also won't detach from the live domain. It sees the
device already detached from the persistent domain and doesn't attempt
to detach from the live domain.

This is a serious problem because it's possible for a volume to be
attached to two live domains and data corruption can occur.

This adds an attempt to detach from the live domain even if we had
already detached from the persistent domain in the past.

Closes-Bug: #1707238

[1] https://review.openstack.org/386257

Change-Id: I8cd056fa17184a98c31547add0e9fb2d363d0908
(cherry picked from commit d39934ad6afb7e2729bb45235f363ada86012d15)

commit_message:
libvirt: fix alternative_device_name for detaching interfaces

There are two changes here:

1. Get the actual vif device name for logging, e.g. tap3e81295f-c1
2. Log that in detach_device_with_retry so we're not logging an
   LibvirtConfigGuestInterface object.

Change-Id: I7588c17a9936eb765269c662cad4cbedc5f58fbf

  * adds a class-wide backup shared by test_show_backup and

commit_message:
Volume test for backup:backup_project_attribute

Add RBAC test for "backup:backup_project_attribute" which verifies
that the "os-backup-project-attr:project_id" attribute appears in
the response body only policy enforcement succeeds.

This commit specifically:
  * adds the test specified above
  * adds a class-wide backup shared by test_show_backup and
    test_show_backup_project_attribute tests
  * makes volume a class-wide resource

Change-Id: Ib832c5eebae7f189c508118c0df1710239eba42d

revisions:
[{'number': 8, 'created': '2017-08-15 13:48:05.000000000', 'files': ['tempest/api/compute/admin/test_servers_on_multinodes.py'], 'message': "Add compute test for ServerGroupAntiAffinityFilter

We have a test for the ServerGroupAffinityFilter but
we don't have one for ServerGroupAntiAffinityFilter
which requires two compute hosts. As the FilterScheduler
in Nova relies more and more on the Placement
service and allocation tracking between multiple compute
nodes, and we have started blocking up-calls from the
nova-compute service to the nova-scheduler service via
the superconductor configuration in devstack, it becomes
increasingly important that we actually test the
affinity/anti-affinity server group scenarios.

Change-Id: Id3f4b1a8c6bb7c6f747ba28e7a3657d1e833595f
"}]
commit_message:
Add compute test for ServerGroupAntiAffinityFilter

We have a test for the ServerGroupAffinityFilter but
we don't have one for ServerGroupAntiAffinityFilter
which requires two compute hosts. As the FilterScheduler
in Nova relies more and more on the Placement
service and allocation tracking between multiple compute
nodes, and we have started blocking up-calls from the
nova-compute service to the nova-scheduler service via
the superconductor configuration in devstack, it becomes
increasingly important that we actually test the
affinity/anti-affinity server group scenarios.

Change-Id: Id3f4b1a8c6bb7c6f747ba28e7a3657d1e833595f

commit_message:
libvirt: add debug logging in detach_device_with_retry

When we hit failures in this method it can be hard to
sort out from a traceback what actually happened, and
if we failed from the intial detach or if we failed
during the retry loop.

This patch adds some simple debug logging statements
to help give context to what's going on when we need
to debug a failure in this operation.

Change-Id: I392192f139ced077664e54469eead0b0df9ebf4a
Related-Bug: #1673483
(cherry picked from commit 33d0b029f1927a455b6b00f41b4d83ed19a694ff)
(cherry picked from commit 0e21bbde99b765f97100c832d3a81df1fee5b23b)

[{'number': 2, 'created': '2017-08-14 10:55:18.000000000', 'files': ['docker/services/gnocchi-api.yaml', 'docker/services/panko-api.yaml', 'docker/services/aodh-api.yaml', 'docker/services/neutron-api.yaml', 'docker/services/heat-engine.yaml', 'docker/services/nova-api.yaml'], 'message': "Bind mount tripleo.cnf in transient bootstrap containers

Various containerized services (e.g. nova, neutron, heat) run initial set up
steps with some ephemeral containers that don't use kolla_start. The
tripleo.cnf file is not copied in /etc/my.cnf.d and this can break some
deployments (e.g. when using internal TLS, service lack SSL settings).

Fix the configuration of transient containers by bind mounting of the

Change-Id: I5246f9d52fcf8c8af81de7a0dd8281169c971577
Closes-Bug: #1710127
Co-Authored-By: Juan Antonio Osorio Robles <jaosorior@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Bind mount tripleo.cnf in transient bootstrap containers

Various containerized services (e.g. nova, neutron, heat) run initial set up
steps with some ephemeral containers that don't use kolla_start. The
tripleo.cnf file is not copied in /etc/my.cnf.d and this can break some
deployments (e.g. when using internal TLS, service lack SSL settings).

Fix the configuration of transient containers by bind mounting of the
tripleo.cnf file when kolla_start is not used.

Change-Id: I5246f9d52fcf8c8af81de7a0dd8281169c971577
Closes-Bug: #1710127
Co-Authored-By: Juan Antonio Osorio Robles <jaosorior@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Convert network templates to be rendered via j2

Use the network.network.j2.yaml to render these files, instead
of relying on the hard-coded versions.

Note this doesn't currently consider the _v6 templates as we may want
to deprecate these and instead rely on an ipv6 specific network_data file,
or perhaps make the network/network.network.j2.yaml generic and able to
detect the version from the cidr?

Change-Id: I662e8d0b3737c7807d18c8917bfce1e25baa3d8a
Partially-Implements: blueprint composable-networks

commit_message:
Make net_config ChoiceField themable

Now net_config ChoiceField option value is null, this will cause create
env network filed always gives error: This filed is required.

This patch make net_config ChoiceField themable, will fix this error.

Closes-Bug: #1710557

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 2750, 'name': 'Sean Dague', 'email': 'sean@dague.net', 'username': 'sdague'}, {'_account_id': 6873, 'name': 'Matt Riedemann', 'email': 'mriedem.os@gmail.com', 'username': 'mriedem'}, {'_account_id': 8556, 'name': 'Ghanshyam', 'display_name': 'Ghanshyam Maan', 'email': 'gmaan@ghanshyammann.com', 'username': 'ghanshyam'}, {'_account_id': 9732, 'name': 'Mellanox CI', 'email': 'mlnx-openstack-ci@dev.mellanox.co.il', 'username': 'mellanox', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 10118, 'name': 'IBM PowerKVM CI', 'email': 'kvmpower@linux.vnet.ibm.com', 'username': 'powerkvm', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 12898, 'name': 'Tony Breeds', 'email': 'tony@bakeyournoodle.com', 'username': 'tonyb'}, {'_account_id': 14595, 'name': 'z Systems KVM', 'email': 'zkvm-ci@linux.vnet.ibm.com', 'username': 'ibm-zkvm-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 16128, 'name': 'IBM PowerVM CI', 'email': 'powervmci@linux.vnet.ibm.com', 'username': 'powervmci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 16376, 'name': 'Intel NFV CI', 'email': 'openstack-nfv-ci@intel.com', 'username': 'intel-nfv-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 20040, 'name': 'Microsoft Hyper-V Compute CI', 'email': 'microsoft_nova_ci@microsoft.com', 'username': 'microsoft_nova_ci'}, {'_account_id': 21279, 'name': 'Patricia Domingues', 'email': 'patricia.domingues@canonical.com', 'username': 'patriciasd'}, {'_account_id': 26515, 'name': 'Cloudbase Nova Hyper-V CI', 'email': 'nova_hyperv_ci@cloudbasesolutions.com', 'username': 'nova_hyperv_ci'}]
