reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 1561, 'name': 'Russell Bryant', 'email': 'rbryant@redhat.com', 'username': 'russellb'}, {'_account_id': 6773, 'name': 'Lucas Alvares Gomes', 'email': 'lucasagomes@gmail.com', 'username': 'lucasagomes'}, {'_account_id': 8788, 'name': 'Miguel Angel Ajo', 'email': 'mangelajo@redhat.com', 'username': 'mangelajo'}, {'_account_id': 8871, 'name': 'Elastic Recheck', 'username': 'elasticrecheck'}, {'_account_id': 10237, 'name': 'Numan Siddique', 'email': 'nusiddiq@redhat.com', 'username': 'numansiddique'}, {'_account_id': 10267, 'name': 'venkata anil', 'email': 'anilvenkata@redhat.com', 'username': 'anil'}, {'_account_id': 23567, 'name': 'Luis Tomas Bolivar', 'email': 'ltomasbo@redhat.com', 'username': 'ltomasbo'}, {'_account_id': 23804, 'name': 'Daniel Alvarez', 'email': 'dalvarez@redhat.com', 'username': 'dalvarez'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 9, 'created': '2017-08-14 09:52:10.000000000', 'files': ['networking_ovn/common/ovn_client.py', 'networking_ovn/tests/unit/ml2/test_trunk_driver.py', 'networking_ovn/tests/unit/ml2/test_mech_driver.py', 'networking_ovn/ovsdb/impl_idl_ovn.py', 'networking_ovn/ml2/mech_driver.py', 'networking_ovn/ml2/trunk_driver.py', 'networking_ovn/tests/functional/test_trunk_driver.py', 'networking_ovn/tests/unit/fakes.py'], 'message': "subports: add binding support to them

Current trunk/subports support in OVN doesn't allow subports to
transition from DOWN to ACTIVE when they're attached to a trunk port.
Projects like kuryr-kubernetes need this to happen since it is the
way to identify when a nested VM or container inside a VM are ready.

This patch does the following changes:

- When a port transitions to 'up', before completing the provisioning
  block, binding:host_id is updated on the Neutron port to the parent
  value. This will make the plugin to try to bind the port and hence,
  transition from DOWN to ACTIVE.

- When a subport is added or removed from the trunk, the
  binding:profile information is updated on the Neutron port according
  to what was introduced by e9f430135ce83bc98301739f40a8bdea7862f55a.
  If we don't set this value, parent_port would be cleared during the
  binding process [0] and OVN would unbind it from the chassis.

Closes-bug: #1707141

[0] https://github.com/openstack/networking-ovn/blob/master/networking_ovn/common/ovn_client.py#L185

Change-Id: I62b3113f93572ac860fe5ebdd190907f35d4910f
"}]
commit_message:
subports: add binding support to them

Current trunk/subports support in OVN doesn't allow subports to
transition from DOWN to ACTIVE when they're attached to a trunk port.
Projects like kuryr-kubernetes need this to happen since it is the
way to identify when a nested VM or container inside a VM are ready.

This patch does the following changes:

- When a port transitions to 'up', before completing the provisioning
  block, binding:host_id is updated on the Neutron port to the parent
  value. This will make the plugin to try to bind the port and hence,
  transition from DOWN to ACTIVE.

- When a subport is added or removed from the trunk, the
  binding:profile information is updated on the Neutron port according
  to what was introduced by e9f430135ce83bc98301739f40a8bdea7862f55a.
  If we don't set this value, parent_port would be cleared during the
  binding process [0] and OVN would unbind it from the chassis.

Closes-bug: #1707141

[0] https://github.com/openstack/networking-ovn/blob/master/networking_ovn/common/ovn_client.py#L185

Change-Id: I62b3113f93572ac860fe5ebdd190907f35d4910f

subject: Allow MariaDB repo overrides without extra-vars
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2017-08-11 07:54:01.000000000', 'files': ['vars/redhat-7.yml', 'vars/ubuntu-14.04.yml', 'vars/ubuntu-16.04.yml', 'defaults/main.yml'], 'message': 'Allow MariaDB repo overrides without extra-vars

It may be required to override the repo information
in its entirety, rather than just the URL. This
patch allows that to be done.

Backport notes:
This patch makes adjustments to the primary variables
used while still maintaining backwards compatibility.
The variables to override are now all consistent
regardless of distro, as is the case for Ocata onwards.

Change-Id: I9cfd0ae520b9b584ddc50933311c3fdb555d5029
(cherry picked from commit 96021e839fb7938a4033cc9b021d22df0111a66e)
'}]
commit_message:
Allow MariaDB repo overrides without extra-vars

It may be required to override the repo information
in its entirety, rather than just the URL. This
patch allows that to be done.

Backport notes:
This patch makes adjustments to the primary variables
used while still maintaining backwards compatibility.
The variables to override are now all consistent
regardless of distro, as is the case for Ocata onwards.

Change-Id: I9cfd0ae520b9b584ddc50933311c3fdb555d5029
(cherry picked from commit 96021e839fb7938a4033cc9b021d22df0111a66e)

subject: Replaces yaml.load() with yaml.safe_load() in horizon
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-07-20 09:34:12.000000000', 'files': ['openstack_dashboard/test/tests/templates.py'], 'message': "Replaces yaml.load() with yaml.safe_load() in horizon

Python objects returned with Yaml.load() may be dangerous if you receive
a YAML document from an untrusted source such as the Internet.
The function yaml.safe_load() limits this ability to simple Python
objects like integers or lists.

In ordered_load we're adding a custom class so we have to use yaml.load.
In order to make it safe, set the base class to SafeLoader instead of
Loader.

Reference:
https://security.openstack.org/guidelines/dg_avoid-dangerous-input-parsing-libraries.html

Change-Id: I7fd82bdf12ed52e01ee60d1628d1176c94683e5f
"}]
commit_message:
Replaces yaml.load() with yaml.safe_load() in horizon

Python objects returned with Yaml.load() may be dangerous if you receive
a YAML document from an untrusted source such as the Internet.
The function yaml.safe_load() limits this ability to simple Python
objects like integers or lists.

In ordered_load we're adding a custom class so we have to use yaml.load.
In order to make it safe, set the base class to SafeLoader instead of
Loader.

Reference:
https://security.openstack.org/guidelines/dg_avoid-dangerous-input-parsing-libraries.html

Change-Id: I7fd82bdf12ed52e01ee60d1628d1176c94683e5f

tasks: container_create: Use lxc-clone as fallback to lxc-copy

deprecated lxc-clone tool for older lxc releases.

commit_message:
Remove the reload from the cinder playbook

This removes the reload from the cinder playbook because it's causing
the cinder service(s) to consume 100% CPU which causes gate issues, and
will result in misbehaving deployments in prod.

Change-Id: Ifd3b7b7b177dfb7d6456f802284046dd7ce96a9a
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

commit_message:
Remove journal leftovers

The deadline for the Pike release is near [0] and after some performance
tests against the journal approach I'm not convinced that this is the
right way of fixing the problem.

So, in order to not carry over database migrations and whatnot from an
incompleted feature into a release this patch is removing the leftover
code so we can start fresh with a different mechanism on the next
release cycle.

[0] https://releases.openstack.org/pike/schedule.html

Related-Bug: #1605089
Change-Id: I6a839c8c5fa045ccdb7098039429fd62c872652d

subject: Add evaluation_interval option
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2017-07-19 07:42:37.000000000', 'files': ['ansible/roles/ceilometer/templates/ceilometer.conf.j2'], 'message': 'Add evaluation_interval option

In ceilometer.conf there is a setting evaluation_interval.

The default is set to 60 seconds.

In pipeline.yaml,there is an interval set for those sources as well,
default value 300 seconds.

The evaluation_interval must be set >= the source interval in pipeline.yaml
or else when the evaluator runs it wont find any recent data
and set the state to insufficient data.

see:
https://docs.openstack.org/ocata/config-reference/telemetry/alarming-config-options.html

Change-Id: I82f061d1affc5c3ade75496684fe66e17928e1f3
Closes-Bug: #1704328
'}]
commit_message:
Add evaluation_interval option

In ceilometer.conf there is a setting evaluation_interval.

The default is set to 60 seconds.

In pipeline.yaml,there is an interval set for those sources as well,
default value 300 seconds.

The evaluation_interval must be set >= the source interval in pipeline.yaml
or else when the evaluator runs it wont find any recent data
and set the state to insufficient data.

see:
https://docs.openstack.org/ocata/config-reference/telemetry/alarming-config-options.html

Change-Id: I82f061d1affc5c3ade75496684fe66e17928e1f3
Closes-Bug: #1704328

commit_message:
Support before_end parameter in the REST API

Currently, the action taken before the end of a lease is specified by a
configuration option. This patch enables users to specify the action
through the 'before_end' parameter of the lease creation request.

Change-Id: I90fb90d9d53814791d863f4ce5dab28388d3688d
Partially Implements: blueprint on-end-options

subject: Ensure _galera_repo_url is defined
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-08-14 12:49:17.000000000', 'files': ['vars/redhat-7.yml', 'vars/ubuntu-14.04.yml', 'vars/ubuntu-16.04.yml'], 'message': 'Ensure _galera_repo_url is defined

Galera server currently rewires some of the variables defined
in the galera_client role, and you could end up, when running
galera_server (which has galera_client as dependency) to the
issue of undefined variable _galera_repo_url, therefore
we define it here.

[1]: http://logs.openstack.org/33/492833/3/check/gate-openstack-ansible-galera_server-ansible-func-ubuntu-xenial/9d80560/console.html.gz#_2017-08-11_12_47_40_802451

Change-Id: Id76c8fe60402f85044e0ba9480629a3624907bf2
'}]
commit_message:
Ensure _galera_repo_url is defined

Galera server currently rewires some of the variables defined
in the galera_client role, and you could end up, when running
galera_server (which has galera_client as dependency) to the
issue of undefined variable _galera_repo_url, therefore
we define it here.

[1]: http://logs.openstack.org/33/492833/3/check/gate-openstack-ansible-galera_server-ansible-func-ubuntu-xenial/9d80560/console.html.gz#_2017-08-11_12_47_40_802451

Change-Id: Id76c8fe60402f85044e0ba9480629a3624907bf2

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2017-08-15 07:48:35.000000000', 'files': ['vars/suse-42.yml'], 'message': 'Ensure the btrfs tools are available in SUSE

Starting with 42.3 the dependencies on btrfsprogs became optional
which caused them to be missing in the default test environment.

ref: http://bugzilla.suse.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1053595

Co-Authored-By: Dirk Mueller <dirk@dmllr.de>
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>
Change-Id: I5456a971488812eb997bebd0421ef572f9f4e8ac
'}]
commit_message:
Ensure the btrfs tools are available in SUSE

Starting with 42.3 the dependencies on btrfsprogs became optional
which caused them to be missing in the default test environment.

ref: http://bugzilla.suse.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1053595

Co-Authored-By: Dirk Mueller <dirk@dmllr.de>
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>
Change-Id: I5456a971488812eb997bebd0421ef572f9f4e8ac

subject: Fix unicode issues with Python 3
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2017-08-03 14:33:50.000000000', 'files': ['blazarclient/shell.py'], 'message': 'Fix unicode issues with Python 3

In Python 3, all strings are unicode and the unicode() function has been
removed. For compatibility with both Python 2 and 3, use six.text_type()
instead.

Partially implements: blueprint python-3
Change-Id: I0934e546d0309ddc986fd48b0f13fa5631813dc8
'}]
commit_message:
Fix unicode issues with Python 3

In Python 3, all strings are unicode and the unicode() function has been
removed. For compatibility with both Python 2 and 3, use six.text_type()
instead.

Partially implements: blueprint python-3
Change-Id: I0934e546d0309ddc986fd48b0f13fa5631813dc8

stable/newton was actually testing newton->HEAD instead of
newton->ocata. Let's try to fix this and see what happens.

subject: Use a copy of global literal for each test
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2017-08-15 07:14:32.000000000', 'files': ['karborclient/tests/unit/osc/v1/test_restores.py', 'karborclient/tests/unit/osc/v1/test_checkpoints.py', 'karborclient/tests/unit/osc/v1/test_triggers.py', 'karborclient/tests/unit/osc/v1/test_protectables.py', 'karborclient/tests/unit/osc/v1/test_providers.py', 'karborclient/tests/unit/osc/v1/test_operation_logs.py', 'karborclient/tests/unit/osc/v1/test_plans.py', 'karborclient/tests/unit/osc/v1/test_scheduledoperations.py'], 'message': 'Use a copy of global literal for each test

If global is used in OSC tests, it might be altered, and then the test
result depends on concurrency and order.
Use a copy of the global literal for deterministic results.

Change-Id: I177cc4345c5ed194f2c36d80acc53db113f814e4
'}]
commit_message:
Use a copy of global literal for each test

If global is used in OSC tests, it might be altered, and then the test
result depends on concurrency and order.
Use a copy of the global literal for deterministic results.

Change-Id: I177cc4345c5ed194f2c36d80acc53db113f814e4

revisions:
[{'number': 6, 'created': '2017-08-15 02:32:23.000000000', 'files': ['tests/roles/bootstrap-host/tasks/prepare_aio_config.yml', 'tests/roles/bootstrap-host/templates/user_variables.aio.yml.j2'], 'message': 'Use LXC reverse proxy in OpenStack-CI

This patch implements the use of the images.linuxcontainers.org
reverse proxy when in nodepool. The same implementation as used
for MariaDB and UCA is used - this is not optimal as nodepool
settings may change, but this will do for now.

Depends-On: Ia6b149f157e5697d36fdea3dc65cb2ac4815a1a4
Change-Id: I558663e31264e35a4916c7b636a09cee3910408b
'}]
commit_message:
Use LXC reverse proxy in OpenStack-CI

This patch implements the use of the images.linuxcontainers.org
reverse proxy when in nodepool. The same implementation as used
for MariaDB and UCA is used - this is not optimal as nodepool
settings may change, but this will do for now.

Depends-On: Ia6b149f157e5697d36fdea3dc65cb2ac4815a1a4
Change-Id: I558663e31264e35a4916c7b636a09cee3910408b

subject: Remove support for py34
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2017-07-04 02:47:34.000000000', 'files': ['setup.cfg', 'tox.ini'], 'message': 'Remove support for py34

The gating on python 3.4 is restricted to <= Mitaka. This is due to
the change from Ubuntu Trusty to Xenial, where only python3.5 is
available. There is no need to continue to keep these settings.

Change-Id: I02513724d727fd273b17fbf4549d0b0d5c774a2d
'}]
commit_message:
Remove support for py34

The gating on python 3.4 is restricted to <= Mitaka. This is due to
the change from Ubuntu Trusty to Xenial, where only python3.5 is
available. There is no need to continue to keep these settings.

Change-Id: I02513724d727fd273b17fbf4549d0b0d5c774a2d

Rist', 'email': 'jrist@redhat.com', 'username': 'jrist'}, {'_account_id': 14985, 'name': 'Alex Schultz', 'email': 'aschultz@next-development.com', 'username': 'mwhahaha'}, {'_account_id': 17888, 'name': 'Florian Fuchs', 'email': 'f@florianfuchs.com', 'username': 'flfuchs'}, {'_account_id': 20970, 'name': 'Honza Pokorny', 'email': 'honza@redhat.com', 'username': 'hpokorny'}, {'_account_id': 23181, 'name': 'RDO Third Party CI', 'email': 'dmsimard+rdothirdparty@redhat.com', 'username': 'rdothirdparty', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'number': 14, 'created': '2017-08-08 06:56:17.000000000', 'files': ['releasenotes/notes/gui-logging-5413d0d86e618c59.yaml', 'tripleo_common/tests/utils/test_swift.py', 'tripleo_common/utils/time_functions.py', 'workbooks/plan_management.yaml', 'tripleo_common/constants.py', 'tripleo_common/tests/utils/test_time_functions.py', 'tripleo_common/tests/actions/test_logging_to_swift.py', 'setup.cfg', 'tripleo_common/actions/plan.py', 'tripleo_common/utils/swift.py', 'tripleo_common/actions/logging_to_swift.py'], 'message': 'Add GUI logging workflows

The workflow works like this:

1.  Drain the tripleo Zaqar queue
2.  Format the messages as a log string
3.  Publish the string to a swift object

If the swift object exceeds 10MB, we rotate it.

This patch also includes a workflow to download the latest log via a temporary
url.  The download log action shares a lot of code with the plan export action,
so the common bits were extracted.

Implements: spec gui-logging
Implements: blueprint websocket-logging
Change-Id: I2affd39e85ccfdbaa18590de182104715cfbbed4
'}]
commit_message:
Add GUI logging workflows

The workflow works like this:

1.  Drain the tripleo Zaqar queue
2.  Format the messages as a log string
3.  Publish the string to a swift object

If the swift object exceeds 10MB, we rotate it.

This patch also includes a workflow to download the latest log via a temporary
url.  The download log action shares a lot of code with the plan export action,
so the common bits were extracted.

Implements: spec gui-logging
Implements: blueprint websocket-logging
Change-Id: I2affd39e85ccfdbaa18590de182104715cfbbed4

commit_message:
Use rabbitmq ipv6 flag

The internal details of enabling IPv6 have moved upstream[1], so just
set the ipv6 flag when desired and don't worry about the details
anymore!

[1] https://github.com/puppetlabs/puppetlabs-rabbitmq/pull/552

Closes-Bug: #1710658

Change-Id: Ib22507c4d02f0fae5c0189ab7e040efac3df7e2f

commit_message:
Changes to support new alarm counts api in vitrage

This change is to support the new api as introduced by the
alarm-counts-api blueprint.
- There is a new cli added as well to expose the new api:
  vitrage alarm count
- The bash completion file was also updated

Change-Id: I47b5b2cbb32c742ca15478ee294d341c0137e0b5

Implements: blueprint alarm-counts-api

commit_message:
Horizon SSL handshake errors with apache

Added in "WSGIApplicationGroup %{GLOBAL}" to fix an issue
where horizon will have ssl handshake issues with various
SSL openstack endpoints.

commit_message:
Add python3 capabilities

This change adds python3 capabilities to the pip_install role. This is
being done in preperation for various OpenStack service to begin running
on a python3 environment by default.

Change-Id: I0c1118047594967ba856fa0746ae36c0519a4c6d
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

[1] http://logs.openstack.org/40/484440/9/check/gate-openstack-ansible-os_octavia-ansible-func-ubuntu-xenial/f8835f2/logs/openstack/octavia1/syslog.txt.gz

commit_message:
Fixes failing functional test

The functional tests don't work because the octavia-api uwsgi server
fails because libxml2 is not installed [1]. This should fix that.

[1] http://logs.openstack.org/40/484440/9/check/gate-openstack-ansible-os_octavia-ansible-func-ubuntu-xenial/f8835f2/logs/openstack/octavia1/syslog.txt.gz

Change-Id: If07a64e062daf6cc5e10864913d742075be02d36
